title: Pride of Britain Awards: Susanna Reid wears strapless ball gown
text:
She often cuts a glamorous figure on many a showbiz event.

But Susanna Reid was in a whole new league as she dazzled on the red carpet of the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

The Good Morning Britain host, 48, commanded attention in a strapless hot pink ballgown as she joined a host of other stars at the glittering event.

Wow: Susanna Reid was in a whole new league as she dazzled on the red carpet of the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday

Looking every inch the belle of the ball, Susanna shone in the eye-catching fuchsia silk organza gown by Suzanne Neville which featured a ruched fitted bodice and a dramatic, voluminous skirt and train.

The journalist's raven locks were perfectly styled into chic waves, while she added a glamorous layer of make-up including hot pink lips to match her ensemble.

Rounding off her look, Susanna added a dazzling pair of silver drop earrings.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

Hot stuff: The Good Morning Britain host, 48, commanded attention in a strapless hot pink Suzanne Neville ballgown as she joined a host of other stars at the glittering event

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

Showstopping: Looking every inch the belle of the ball, Susanna shone in the eye-catching fuchsia silk organza gown which featured ruching at the bust and a dramatic, voluminous skirt

Susanna's appearance at the event comes after she discussed her new Daily Mail column during Good Morning Britain earlier this month.

The TV personality held up the front page of the paper, beaming as co-hosts Ben Shephard and Kate Garraway congratulated her on her new role.

The down-to-earth star has vowed to speak candidly about how she juggles motherhood with her presenting duties in her frank weekly Femail column, proving she is' a busy working mum like any other.'

As the trio went through the day's papers, Ben joked: 'There will be other things in the papers to read... your new must read inside the Daily Mail.'

When the headline for her first column flashed up on screen, Susanna joked: "I've stopped trying to be perfect, and so should YOU!"... because I'm certainly not perfect!'

Animated: Susanna appeared to be in a very cheery mood as pulled an animated face on the red carpet
